name: NSMachPort
desc: A port that can be used as an endpoint for distributed object connections (or raw messaging).

items.name: class func port(withMachPort: UInt32) -> Port
items.desc: Creates and returns a port object configured with the given Mach port.

items.name: class func port(withMachPort: UInt32, options: NSMachPort.Options) -> Port
items.desc: Creates and returns a port object configured with the specified options and the given Mach port.

items.name: init(machPort: UInt32)
items.desc: Initializes a newly allocated NSMachPort object with a given Mach port.

items.name: init(machPort: UInt32, options: NSMachPort.Options)
items.desc: Initializes a newly allocated NSMachPort object with a given Mach port and the specified options.

items.name: var machPort: UInt32
items.desc: The Mach port used by the receiver, represented as an integer.

items.name: func remove(from: RunLoop, forMode: RunLoop.Mode)
items.desc: Removes the receiver from the run loop mode mode of runLoop.

items.name: func schedule(in: RunLoop, forMode: RunLoop.Mode)
items.desc: Schedules the receiver into the run loop mode mode of runLoop.

items.name: func setDelegate(NSMachPortDelegate?)
items.desc: Sets the receiver’s delegate to a given object.

items.name: struct NSMachPort.Options
items.desc: Used to remove access rights to a mach port when the NSMachPort object is invalidated or destroyed.
